results.title: Lisa Curry's pregnancy workout
results.creator_credit: Jeff Hogan, Leigh Gower and Carol Lloyd Corporate Theatre
results.brief_description: The golden girl of Australian swimming, Lisa Curry presents this personal pregnancy workout program - a professionally planned and directed series of aerobic-styled exercises you can do each day in the privacy of your own home. Filmed in the Sunshine Coast waterfront home Lisa shares with husband, Grant Kenny - surfing “iron man” and Olympic canoeist -“Lisa Curry’s pregnancy workout” covers a wide range of pregnancy health and fitness topics of assistance to all expectant parents.

results.title: Liquid sky
results.brief_description: A cult classic of the post-punk era, “Liquid Sky” is a bizarre and erotic subversion of the science-fiction film. Set in the New York New Wave fashion milieu, the story concerns a group of aliens that have landed upstairs from fashion model Margaret (Anne Carlisle). The aliens are in search of pure heroin which they need for their biological survival, but while on earth they become addicted to the chemicals secreted by the brain during orgasm. Margaret, who is pursued constantly by men and women, becomes the pivotal conduit for the space creatures’ addiction but, unfortunately for Margaret, the use the aliens make of her body results in the death of her lovers. Wickedly perverse in its delight in the rituals and pleasures of addiction, aptly identifying the paranoias and fears attached to sex with the onslaught of the AIDS epidemic, and cruelly bitchy about the New York art and fashion worlds, “Liquid Sky” is a visionary precursor to the New Queer Cinema of the 1990s. It is directed by Russian emigre director, Slava Tsukerman, and features an inventive original electronic music score by Tsukerman, Brenda Hutchinson and Clive Smith.

results.title: Lionel Hampton and the golden men of jazz
results.brief_description: Live concert from the Munich Summer Piano Festival 1993, featuring Lionel Hampton & The Golden Men of Jazz, performing a dozen jazz tunes. The band are: Lionel Hampton (vibes, drums and vocals), Clark Terry (trumpet), Harry Sweats Edison (trumpet), Al Grey (trombone), Benny Golson (saxaphone), Junior Mance (piano), Jimmy Woody (bass), Panama Francis (drums). Songs include Hamp, Cool Vibes, Lester Leaps In, God Bless the child, Toin Me Loose, Paradise, How High the Moon, I Remember Clifford, Drum On In, Seven Come Eleven, Hey Baba Rebob and What a Wonderful World, A lively and vibrant performance from these jazz wonders.

results.title: Lines and dots
results.brief_description: An animated experimental film in which we see blue dashes and red dots fighting each other when they are brought in close contact with an unknown third power - which destroys the embattled signs and spreads over the whole screen.
results.description: An animated experimental film in which we see blue dashes and red dots fighting each other when they are brought in close contact with an unknown third power - which destroys the embattled signs and spreads over the whole screen.

results.title: Linderidge 137
results.creator_credit: Paul Denby and New Cinema Workshop
results.brief_description: Investigates the conventions of storytelling and suspense. The central theme examines the process whereby women in film are represented as the victims of threat and aggression, as the object of the camera’s voyeuristic gaze.
results.description: Investigates the conventions of storytelling and suspense. The central theme examines the process whereby women in film are represented as the victims of threat and aggression, as the object of the camera’s voyeuristic gaze.
